definitions.definition: join (something) to something else so as to increase the size, number, or amount.
examples: a new wing was added to the building
synonyms: toss in; admix "the back room was added in 1971"

definitions.definition: increase in amount, number, or degree.
examples: watch those air miles add up!
synonyms: reinforce; add fuel to the fire of
rub salt on the wound of "her decision just added to his woe"

definitions.definition: put or mix (an ingredient) together with another as one of the stages in the preparation of a dish.
examples: add the flour to the eggs, stirring continuously

definitions.definition: put (something) in or on something else so as to improve or alter its quality or nature.
examples: chlorine is added to the water to kill bacteria
the canopy will add a touch of class to your bedroom

definitions.definition: put together (two or more numbers or amounts) to calculate their total value.
examples: they added all the figures up
synonyms: tally; datedcast up "they added all the numbers"

examples: this adds up to a total of 400 calories
synonyms: number More"the subsidies added up to $1
be symptomatic of; informalspell "it all adds up to a deepening crisis"make sense
be convincing "the situation just didn't add up"

definitions.definition: seem reasonable or consistent; make sense.
examples: many things in her story didn't add up
synonyms: be convincing "the situation just didn't add up"

examples: “I hope we haven't been too much trouble,” she added politely
synonyms: carry on "she added that she had every confidence in Laura"
